item.title: Building an AI-Powered ArXiv Pipeline: Thought n8n was the future, but not yet
item.author: xuanphuc.a1gv@gmail.com (Felix Hoang)
item.description: This is my story of how I attempt to build an AI-powered pipeline for ArXiv papers. It was a journey that started with a cool idea about AI agents and ended with me wrestling Docker, n8n, and Python into submission.

item.title: SIS ArXiv VAD Papers
item.author: xuanphuc.a1gv@gmail.com (Felix Hoang)
item.description: This repository contains the source code for the “SIS ArXiv VAD Papers” website, a Hugo static site using the Blowfish theme.

item.title: My First Server Was Office Trash: A Self-Hosting Story
item.author: xuanphuc.a1gv@gmail.com (Felix Hoang)
item.description: It all started with a computer my mom saved from the trash heap at her office. It was a standard HP Prodesk 600 G4—nothing special, and since I already had a PC and a laptop, I had no idea what to do with it. Just installing Windows on it felt like a waste. I knew it could be something more than just another desktop collecting dust.
